bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alton P. Tisdel, February 26, 1941

div1.p: Hench orders publications from the U.S. Government Printing Office and encloses a check to cover the charges.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alton P. Tisdel, February 26, 1941
div1.opener:
February 26, 1941
Mr. Alton P. Tisdel
Superintendent of Documents
U.S. Government Printing Office
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Tisdel:
div1.p:
Will you please send me the following publications
which your letter of February 25 states you have available:
Annual Reports of the War Department:
1899, Vol. 1, Part 2........$0.75
1900, Vol. 1, Part 10....... 0.30
1902, Vol. 8.................0.20

I am enclosing a check to cover your
charges.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
